result.execSummary:
The defendant Douglas B. Flynn was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Clerk Cheree
Case called: 8:46am
State appears by ADA C.Minder.  Def appears in person and with Atty Daniel Linehan.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VR not applicable.

State moves to:
Ct. 1 (Escape-Criminal Arrest)>>AMEND to DC pursuant to 947.01(1)
COURT GRANTS ABOVE

PLEA:
Ct. 1 (DC)>> GUILTY

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.

COURT ORDERS: 10 days MCJ w/credit for 10 days of time already served; CC; DNA sample and surcharge.

COURT directs parties to Judicial Assistant at the conclusion of this hearing to schedule trials on remaining open cases.

Adj: 8:56am
Plea hearing on June 20, 2017 at 09:00 am.

COURT directs FPT will be for all cases as already scheduled for 16CM1635 on 11/10 at 9:00; If no agreement, parties must set JT on felony cases.
